Package com.example.haboob

Class AdminUserFragment

java.lang.Object
androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
com.example.haboob.AdminUserFragment
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner, AdminUserAdapter.OnUserActionListener
public class AdminUserFragment extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment implements AdminUserAdapter.OnUserActionListener
Fragment for displaying all user profiles from the database in the admin view. Allows administrators to view all users and delete user accounts.

This fragment provides comprehensive user management functionality for administrators:

  • Loads and displays all users from Firestore
  • Shows user information in a scrollable list
  • Provides user deletion with confirmation dialogs
  • Handles both main user collection and account-specific collections
  • Shows appropriate loading and empty states

The fragment creates appropriate User subclass instances (Entrant or Organizer) based on the account type stored in the database.

See Also:

  • User
  • Entrant
  • Organizer

  • Method Details

    • onCreateView

      @Nullable public android.view.View onCreateView(@NonNull android.view.LayoutInflater inflater, @Nullable android.view.ViewGroup container, @Nullable android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
      Inflates the fragment's layout and initializes all UI components.

      Sets up the RecyclerView with a linear layout manager, initializes Firestore connection, configures toolbar navigation, and loads all users from the database.

      Overrides:
      onCreateView in class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      Parameters:
      inflater - The LayoutInflater object to inflate views
      container - The parent view that the fragment's UI should be attached to
      savedInstanceState - Previously saved state of the fragment, if any
      Returns:
      The root View for the fragment's UI

    • onUserClick

      public void onUserClick(User user)
      Called when a user card is clicked.

      Currently displays a toast with the user's name. This can be extended in the future to navigate to a detailed user profile view for editing or viewing additional information.

      Specified by:
      onUserClick in interface AdminUserAdapter.OnUserActionListener
      Parameters:
      user - The user that was clicked
